meanings.definition: Related to the structure of something.
meanings.sent1: The architect made sure the building was structurally sound.
meanings.sent2: The bridge collapsed because it was not structurally stable.
meanings.sent3: The structurally sound treehouse swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her argument was so structurally sound that it could not be refuted.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces fit together perfectly, forming a structurally sound castle.

meanings.definition: In a way that relates to the arrangement or organization of parts.
meanings.sent1: She organized her notes structurally to make studying easier.
meanings.sent2: The shelves were arranged structurally to maximize space.
meanings.sent3: The books on the shelf were stacked structurally, creating a neat pattern.
meanings.sent4: His schedule was so structurally organized that he never missed a deadline.
meanings.sent5: The team worked structurally to ensure every detail was in place for the presentation.

meanings.definition: In a way that pertains to the construction or framework of something.
meanings.sent1: The house was built structurally to withstand harsh weather.
meanings.sent2: The bridge was designed structurally to support heavy traffic.
meanings.sent3: The cake was decorated structurally, resembling a miniature building.
meanings.sent4: The company was structurally organized for efficient workflow.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted the mural structurally, layering colors to create depth.
